name: circuit
content:
circuit

noun
 
 
/ˈsɜːkɪt/
 
/ˈsɜːrkɪt/
jump to other results
  1. ​
     
    a line, route or journey around a place
    • The race ended with eight laps of a city centre circuit.
    • The earth takes a year to make a circuit of (= go around) the sun.
    Extra Examples
    • We did a complete circuit of the park in twenty minutes.
    • Green Day moves into the lead as they turn into the straight on the first circuit.
    • Runners have to complete fifteen circuits of the two-mile circular course.
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • complete
    verb + circuit
    • do
    • make
    preposition
    • circuit of
    See full entry
  2. ​
     
    the complete path of wires and equipment along which an electric current flows
    • an electrical circuit
    • a circuit diagram (= one showing all the connections in the different parts of the circuit)
    see also closed-circuit television, integrated circuit, logic circuit, printed circuit, ring circuit, short circuitTopics Engineeringb2
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • short
    • closed
    • integrated
    • …
    verb + circuit
    • build
    • break
    • complete
    • …
    circuit + noun
    • diagram
    See full entry
  3. ​(in sport) a series of games or matches in which the same players regularly take part
    • This is her biggest triumph in nine years on the women's tennis circuit.
    • He announced his retirement from the professional circuit last year.
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • amateur
    • professional
    • international
    • …
    verb + circuit
    • hit
    • play
    • tour
    • …
    preposition
    • on a/​the circuit
    See full entry
  4. ​a track for cars or motorcycles to race around
  5. ​a series of places or events of a particular kind at which the same people appear or take part
    • the lecture/cabaret circuit
    see also barbecue circuit
    Extra Examples
    • She's a well-known figure on the international lecture circuit.
    • Talent scouts spotted him playing on the amateur circuit.
    • Young's film has hit the festival circuit in the US.
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • amateur
    • professional
    • international
    • …
    verb + circuit
    • hit
    • play
    • tour
    • …
    preposition
    • on a/​the circuit
    See full entry
  6. ​a series of different exercises that you do one after the other when doing circuit training in sport or fitness training
    • I do circuits in the gym twice a week.
    Topics Health and Fitnessc2, Sports: other sportsc2
  7. ​a regular journey made by a judge to hear court cases in each of the courts of law in a particular area
    • a circuit court/judge
    More Like This Silent lettersSilent letters

name: circuit court
content:
circuit court

noun
 
/ˈsɜːkɪt kɔːt/
 
/ˈsɜːrkɪt kɔːrt/
(North American English)
jump to other results
  1. ​a court of law that meets in various places within the district it is responsible for
    • She is to be tried in Orange County Circuit Court in Orlando.
See circuit court in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary

name: logic circuit
content:
logic circuit

noun
 
/ˈlɒdʒɪk sɜːkɪt/
 
/ˈlɑːdʒɪk sɜːrkɪt/
 (computing)
jump to other results
  1. ​a series of logic gates that performs operations on data that is put into a computerTopics Computersc2
See logic circuit in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary

name: ring circuit
content:
ring circuit

noun
 
/ˈrɪŋ sɜːkɪt/
 
/ˈrɪŋ sɜːrkɪt/
(also ring main)
(specialist)
jump to other results
  1. ​an arrangement of wires that supply electricity to several different places in a room or building
Check pronunciation: ring circuit

name: short circuit
content:
short circuit

noun
 
/ˌʃɔːt ˈsɜːkɪt/
 
/ˌʃɔːrt ˈsɜːrkɪt/
(also informal short)
jump to other results
  1. ​a failure in an electrical circuit, when electricity travels along the wrong route because of damaged wires or a fault in the connections between the wires
    • The fire was caused by a short circuit.
    • The lights were not working because of a short circuit.
    Topics Engineeringc2
See short circuit in the Oxford Advanced American DictionarySee short circuit in the Oxford Learner's Dictionary of Academic English
Check pronunciation: short circuit

name: short-circuit
content:
short-circuit

verb
 
/ˌʃɔːt ˈsɜːkɪt/
 
/ˌʃɔːrt ˈsɜːrkɪt/
(also informal short)
Verb Forms
present simple I / you / we / they short-circuit
 
/ˌʃɔːt ˈsɜːkɪt/
 
/ˌʃɔːrt ˈsɜːrkɪt/
he / she / it short-circuits
 
/ˌʃɔːt ˈsɜːkɪts/
 
/ˌʃɔːrt ˈsɜːrkɪts/
past simple short-circuited
 
/ˌʃɔːt ˈsɜːkɪtɪd/
 
/ˌʃɔːrt ˈsɜːrkɪtɪd/
past participle short-circuited
 
/ˌʃɔːt ˈsɜːkɪtɪd/
 
/ˌʃɔːrt ˈsɜːrkɪtɪd/
-ing form short-circuiting
 
/ˌʃɔːt ˈsɜːkɪtɪŋ/
 
/ˌʃɔːrt ˈsɜːrkɪtɪŋ/
jump to other results
  1. ​[intransitive, transitive] short-circuit (something) to have a short circuit; to make something have a short circuit
    • The wires had short-circuited and burnt out.
  2. ​[transitive] short-circuit something to succeed in doing something more quickly than usual, without going through all the usual processes
    • The process of becoming a politician can be short-circuited if you are already a well-known public figure.
    Topics Successc2
See short-circuit in the Oxford Advanced American DictionarySee short-circuit in the Oxford Learner's Dictionary of Academic English
Check pronunciation: short-circuit

name: barbecue circuit
content:
barbecue circuit

noun
 
/ˈbɑːbɪkjuː sɜːkɪt/
 
/ˈbɑːrbɪkjuː sɜːrkɪt/
(Canadian English)
jump to other results
  1. ​(in Canadian politics) a period of time in the summer when politicians take time off from their usual duties to attend events in order to meet members of the community
    • All MPs worked the barbecue circuit this summer.
Check pronunciation: barbecue circuit

name: circuit breaker
content:
circuit breaker

noun
 
/ˈsɜːkɪt breɪkə(r)/
 
/ˈsɜːrkɪt breɪkər/
jump to other results
  1. ​a device that will stop an electric current if it becomes dangerousTopics Engineeringc2
  2. ​a short period during which laws are in place to limit people's movements, especially to require most people to stay at home in order to stop the spread of disease
    • The four-week circuit breaker will come into force tomorrow with the closure of pubs, bars, restaurants and non-essential shops.
    compare lockdownTopics Health and Fitnessc2, Law and justicec2
Check pronunciation: circuit breaker
